"Please Come Home for Christmas" is a Christmas song, released in 1960, by the American blues singer and pianist Charles Brown. Hitting BillboardÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s Hot 100 chart in December of 1961, the tune Brown co-wrote with Gene Redd peaked at position #76. It appeared on the Christmas Singles chart for nine seasons, hitting #1 in 1972. It includes a number of characteristics of Christmas music, such as multiple references in the lyrics to the Christmas season and Christmas traditions, and the use of a church bell type sound, created using a piano, at the start of the song.

Bon Jovi covered and recorded the song for the A Very Special Christmas 2 compilation album, as well as a single. The album reached a chart position of #7 on the U.S. Billboard 200 charts in December of 1992. The single release also included the songs "Back Door Santa" and "I Wish Every Day Could Be Like Christmas" from the first A Very Special Christmas album.

The cover art pictures Jon Bon Jovi in an intimate embrace and near kiss with Cindy Crawford.
